title: Boy, 7, shot in Sandusky today
content:
SANDUSKY — A 7-year-old child was flown to Cleveland Rainbow Babies and Children’s Hospital after being shot today.
The child, whose name police have not released, was last known to be in an intensive-care unit, police said.
The initial call to Sandusky police, which came at 1:45 p.m., was that the shooting was an accidental, self-inflicted wound, police said. Officers and investigators from the Bureau of Criminal Investigation have not determined the circumstances, police said.
Two adults, whose names police also have not been released, were in the home at 219 Center St. when the shooting occurred. It was not known whether any other children were there. No other injuries were reported, and no charges had been filed Sunday.
